intro: Ardisia merrillii, commonly known as the Philippine ardisia, is a flowering plant species native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. Ardisia merrillii typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some horticultural settings.
